fields.description:
Bitbucket Academic License request form (http://atlassian.com/software/views/bitbucket-academic-license.jsp) *removes non-latin (polish) characters* from users input.

For example  - my name is //'Michał'// (//Michal//, with last character 'l with stroke', aka unicode character U+0142), but my account was created using name //'Micha'//.

I've used polish characters, but other eurpean languages like german of french also has their own diacritcs, it should be checked.

Set of characters from polish alphabet being removed:

//ęóąśłżźćń ĘÓĄŚŁŻŹĆŃ//

I've succesfully corrected my personal details - *form in My Profile accepts polish characters*.

fields.description:
Hi,

{code}
First I would like to thank you for the great service you delivery. My dev team is finally upgrading to the paid plan, but we are currently having a strange error, every git pull or git clone is returning the same message: "aborting due a possible repository corruption on the remote side".

Bellow follows a test:
{code}

{{{\\
tatto@tattobook3:~/Desktop/teste$ git clone https://bitbucket.org/serverdoin/mercadodetroca.git\\
Cloning into mercadodetroca...\\
Username:\\
Password:\\
remote: Counting objects: 2634, done.\\
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (1659/1659), done.\\
remote: aborting due to possible repository corruption on the remote side.\\
fatal: early EOFs:  11% (290/2634), 124.00 KiB | 113 KiB/s\\
fatal: index-pack failed\\
}}}

{code}
The error is always in the same part. We tried a lot of thing but error is always happening.

Can you give us a little help?

Thanks in advance,  Tatto <bitbucket: tatto>
{code}
fields.summary: Repository corruption on the remote side

15:15:21 Checking out https://igloocoder.net:8443/svn/IglooCommons/trunk/...\\

fields.description:
I recently converted an old CVS repository to Mercurial, and pushed the result into a new bitbucket repository. When looking at changesets, I cam across one that apparently confuses bitbucket quite a lot; if you scroll down the bottom of the following URL, the diff output is completely garbled at the end.

https://bitbucket.org/mumux/csup/changeset/8b3217c1cfa0

I verified the problem using different and up-to-date web browsers (namely, Firefox 10.0.2 and Chromium 17.0.963.56). This is the only changeset I saw that exhibits this problem.
fields.summary: Garbled diff output for big changeset (BB-3656)

fields.description:
Oftentimes, pull request changes are made directly to the 'default' branch of a repo. That's generally where the main developers do their stuff. This often means that external pull request changes will conflict, which makes integration with the pull request API impossible. You have to merge things locally and stuff.

It would be better to pull the changesets over and immediately fork them into a new branch. This process would ensure that the 'default' branch would remain working and reasonable, and that the developers could merge the new branch into the main line as needed. Such merging could involve the creation of additional changesets, like adding appropriate tests to a bug fix, and so forth. All of this info would be tracked, and everything would make sense.
fields.summary: Allow users to edit the destination of a pull request (BB-3651)

fields.description:
Currently you can only search repos by name.  It would be great to have some advanced features.  The biggest ones I can see are:

* Language
* Followers/Forks
* Activity

It would be also be nice if you could add more than one language that your project uses and tags that people could search for.  Also if you could put your project in a couple of groups such as commandline, gui, text processing, web and others so that people can find appropriate projects.

This makes it much easier for people to find repositories to help.  I often find myself without a project of my own and I would like to help someone out but I can't easily find repos in one of my preferred languages.

Also, if I am thinking of starting a project but I don't know if it exists a better search functionality could help me find what I am looking for,
fields.summary: Add Advances Repositories Search

fields.description:
find a private repository, rename it as ".", and save

now you are not able to access it again (neither rename it back).
fields.summary: accidently renamed my repository name as ".", now no longer to access it. (BB-3657)

fields.description:
Is there functionality to save wiki pages and continue previewing, all in one click? It seems that the only option is to click the save button, then click the edit link on the page, then click the preview button at the bottom.

I'm a bit of an obsessive file saver, especially since drafts aren't automatically saved by the UI. It would be a lot more convenient if I could edit, then save and preview at the click of a single button, all in small iterations.
fields.summary: Single click save and preview in wiki

I had to git push something to resolve the issue.

P.S. Why can't I import a hg repo into git repo? Just like I'm able to import an svn repo into git repo. I don't mind the lost commit history.

It's similar to Visual Basic.  Home site is http://www.powerbasic.com

Thanks for your consideration.

Mark
fields.summary: Request to Add Language to Programming Language
Long repository names causes "compare fork" and "create pull request" buttons to drop to the next line and they can't be clicked (BB-3648)

fields.description:
The site/master issue tracker is full of "+1" posts. It would make more sense to let people vote for issues (similar to Google code).

There may also be an argument for incorporating a "heat" metric similar to launchpad. Heat should be based on issue votes and priority if implemented. The simplicity of a vote mechanism may be prefferable, however.

Either way, a numerical value of the "score" which can be filtered and sorted in the main issue list views would make it easier to prioritise and plan development work for larger projects based on their perceived importance.
fields.summary: Add ability to vote for issues (BB-3647)

fields.description: When I click Reset Password and then click on the emailed link, I still am getting an error message preventing me from resetting my passcode.
fields.summary: RESET PASSWORD 400 ERROR

fields.description:
This isn't a bug. I'm just not very adept with SSH - I've gone through your troubleshooting guides and I still can't resolve the issue.

I'm attempting to clone a git repository in a remote server, and I'm wondering if someone can help me troubleshoot. I've added my localhost rsa key to the remote host and to my bitbucket profile. when i run ssh git@bitbucket.org from my local machine it works fine.  Below is the verbose output from the remote host when I run ssh -v git@bitbucket.org on the web server:

{{{\\
#!python

OpenSSH_4.3p2, OpenSSL 0.9.8e-fips-rhel5 01 Jul 2008\\

debug1: Applying options for *\\
debug1: Connecting to bitbucket.org [207.223.240.181] port 22.\\
debug1: Connection established.\\
debug1: permanently_set_uid: 0/0\\
debug1: identity file /root/.ssh/identity type -1\\

Regards,\\
Pete Thompson

fields.description:
We don't use named branches for things like:\\
-development\\
-QA\\
-master\\
-staging\\
Instead, we use forked repos as outlined here:\\
http://groups.google.com/group/bitbucket-users/msg/cb486cd1b0a5ba42\\
Is there a way to pull changes from the main repository into forked\\
repos via pull requests? Currently, the dropdown doesn't show forked/\\
downstream repos.\\
From this bitbucket blog (http://blog.bitbucket.org/2012/02/01/pull-\\
requests-across-branches/),\\
I know pull requests support different branches within a single repo,\\
but this is not what we're looking for.

Related:http://groups.google.com/group/bitbucket-users/browse_thread/thread/e4a092a6180d5809
fields.summary: Downstream pull request from main repo to forked repo

fields.description: In your tutorial section 'Fork a Repo, Compare Code, and Create a Pull Request', there is a bug with enumeration. Step 4 is twice , Step 5 is missing.
fields.summary: Enumeration bug

fields.description:
Could BlitzMax be added as a language? See http://blitzmax.com/Products/blitzmax.php

//BlitzMax is the new, next generation game programming language from Blitz Research. BlitzMax retains the BASIC roots of Blitz3D and BlitzPlus, but adds a ton of cool new features and abilities.//

It's been around for quite a while, though. And even though it isn't widely used as other languages, it //is// a language on its own. Plus it has an active community to boot and there's some cool stuff being made in it and featured on the main BlitzMax site.

A (slightly outdated) document with functions, constants, operators and compiler directives can be found here:

http://www.eiksoft.com/ueindex.htm

Please see link 'BlitzMax 1.14 Wordlist' on that page. A bit down (also on that page) are the colors the original IDE uses.

If BlitzMax language can not (for whatever reason) be added, could I request a language 'Other' or 'Misc' to be added for projects with such relatively exotic languages? With no syntax highlighting, of course.
fields.summary: BlitzMax language request (BB-3639)

The code that's in a comment is light gray, a lot of it is light orange, and even the code itself (at the bottom of the page) is really hard to read.

Would really appreciate not having to squint to read my own code.

fields.summary: do you have a feature for setting up a deployment key (BB-3640)

fields.description:
I accidently pushed a commit (using git) with 800 MB of data to bitbucket. When I realized this, I rewrote history to remove the large files from the commit and pushed (with --force) the new commit to bitbucket.

In my own repository I managed to purge all the dangling objects from git, saving 800 MB worth of disk space, if you do care about disk usage, I would recommend that you implement something that cleans up the repository after a forced push.
fields.summary: Purge dangling objects in Git

Screenshots are attached and here are some links to some affected documents https://bitbucket.org/winstonw/lolwut/raw/5e4250c864e4/README and https://bitbucket.org/winstonw/lolwut/changeset/5e4250c864e4/raw/.

The links should render correctly if your web browser falls back on UTF-8. I found this issue present in Opera 11.61, lynx, and Chromium 17.

fields.description:
I have updated Robert Elliot's Jenkins broker to use the Jenkins api. In doing so I have made it easier to use with secured servers and with builds that require parameters. My fork is available here:\\
https://bitbucket.org/KitB/jenkins-broker/

It expects the following fields in service:

* endpoint: the protocol, hostname and port of the Jenkins instance. e.g. https://build.myorg.com:8080
* project_name: The name of the job to be run on the Jenkins server
* token: The security token for the job to allow scripted builds
* module_name: As in the original broker, this allows for a specific directory within the repository to be watched for changes
* user_id: the username to login as, required only if the server is secured
* api_token: the token corresponding to the above user id, again required only for a secure server
* params: The parameters that will be passed to a build (a dict, I believe)
fields.summary: Integrate updated broker for Jenkins (BB-3633)

fields.description:
Last night I accepted a pull request from Repo pamanseau/chalets-rentals.com-server to pamanseau/chalets-rentals.com but after 30 minutes the screen didn't move, so I click on the X to close the windows and check the main repo chalets-rentals.com and the changes were not there.

I decided to rename the chalets-rentals.com-server to chalets-rentals.com-joomla2.5 and folk the main repo chalets-rentals.com to chalets-rentals.com-server but the screen looped on the CLONING screen and never got pass this screen. If I go back in the repo chalets-rentals.com-server it's still the same CLONING screen.

I tried to push to the main repo chalets-rentals.com and I have this error:

hg push --new-branch https://pamanseau@bitbucket.org/pamanseau/chalets-rentals.com\\
pushing to https://pamanseau@bitbucket.org/pamanseau/chalets-rentals.com\\
http authorization required\\
realm: Bitbucket.org HTTP\\
user: pamanseau\\
password:searching for changes\\
abort: HTTP Error 500: Internal Server Error\\
Completed with errors, see above
fields.summary: After accepting Pull Request in main repo pamanseau/chalets-rentals.com now give HTTP Errror 500

fields.description:
When I issue a 'push' request, I get the following exception and stack trace back:

{{{\\

fields.description:
I have a Git repo, that does not display my README.md file on overview:\\
https://bitbucket.org/drozdyuk/vimfiles/overview

But if I change it to README.txt, it works.

Is this a bug or a feature?
fields.summary: Markdown README not displayed in Git repository

fields.description:
I'm the only person on most of my projects and I don't like getting emails every time I update/create my own cases. However, if I do add another person to the project at a later time, I will want to get email updates, without having to go into every case and check "follow issue updates".

I propose the option to configure issue tracker emails to only be sent if there is more than one person on a project.
fields.summary: only send issue follow emails when more than one person on project

I've created a new broker (https://bitbucket.org/thorque/jenkins-integration-bitbucket-broker/wiki/Home).\\

All is under Apache 2.0 license.

fields.description:
Hey,

It would be very nice to have read-only users to each repository, so that one can deploy to servers without\\
a: creating extra full users (adding a user per repository (or even per server))\\
b: giving the server read-write access by just adding a public key to one's account.

Thanks for the great service!
fields.summary: Read-only deploy users for deploying via repository (BB-67)

fields.description:
User asked for this README enhancement on the doc page:

I thought, it would apply to any readme file, not only the one at root.

Currently it seems to show everywhere only the readme from root, regardless presence of any readme file in current directory.

Proposal for enhancement: Show content of readme as now, just start searching from currently listed directory and traverse up untill some readme is found.

This will allow to show independent directory descriptions.

jan.vlcinsky@gmail.com

I am logging the enhancement here for tracking.
fields.summary: README Anywhere (BB-3616)

fields.description:
I noticed that the default algorithm for automatically assigning BitBucker users to commit users only works if they look like: "User [user%40domain.com]"

It does not work if commit users contains some characters (eg. "User (something) [user%40domain.com]") and most importantly it doesn't work when the email address is not on the end (eg. "User [user%40domain.com] [http://homepage.com/]"). I am using the last form with an URL and would therefore appreciate if the expression for matching users would be improved to match the email anywhere.

(On GitHub this works and the user gets matched as long as he has one of his email addresses between "<" and ">" anywhere in the string.)
fields.summary: Improvement to automatic user detection (BB-3589)

fields.description:
If I create a public repository, and after that I make it private, it's icon on the mainpage http://bitbucket.org ( I am logged in ), remains the same as for a public one.  However, after a number of hours passes, it appears correctly.\\
I disabled caching in my browser and it still acts in the same way.
fields.summary: Changes to repository's privacy icon are not visible right away (BB-3592)

fields.description:
When I created issue titled "follow", the permalink of this issue is following:

* https://bitbucket.org/[user]/[project_name]/issue/[issue_number]/follow

This permalink is the link to following issue.

So when I will open this issue, I will follow this issue against my expected.

But it's not only follow, after followed, redirect, unfollow, redirect, follow... Oops, it's infinity loop!!

By ordinary, the issue titled "follow" is unnecessary.\\
But I want to submit the issue in a language other than English.\\
(e.g. "follow 機能を作成する"

In this case, this permalink is following:

* https://bitbucket.org/[user]/[project_name]/issue/[issue_number]/follow
fields.summary: The issue that titled "follow" couldn't open

Thanks\\
Itamar.

ps. Will you be integrating with Jira and Confluence?

fields.description:
I'm running through the tutorial and I have configured the password and followed all the steps to getting a key and putting it into the system, and everything seemed to work, but then I'm still prompted for a password every time I get to the "git push" phase of the process. Mary asked me to capture all the cmd line for the problem I'm experiencing.

Thanks,\\
Cyd

h2. {{{\\
MING output
Cyd@CYDWEBTOP ~/repos/bb101repo-practice (master)\\
$ ls -al\\
total 1\\
drwxr-xr-x    3 Cyd      Administ        0 Feb  6 17:38 .\\
drwxr-xr-x    4 Cyd      Administ        0 Feb  6 19:22 ..\\
drwxr-xr-x    7 Cyd      Administ        0 Feb  7 17:03 .git\\
-rw-r--r--    1 Cyd      Administ      214 Feb  7 17:02 README

Cyd@CYDWEBTOP ~/repos/bb101repo-practice (master)\\
$ git add README

Cyd@CYDWEBTOP ~/repos/bb101repo-practice (master)\\
$ git commit -m "another change, this one's for Mary..."\\
[master 17040c4] another change, this one's for Mary...\\
1 files changed, 2 insertions(+), 0 deletions(-)

Cyd@CYDWEBTOP ~/repos/bb101repo-practice (master)\\
$ git push\\
Enter passphrase for key '/c/Documents and Settings/Cyd/.ssh/id_rsa':\\
Counting objects: 5, done.\\
Delta compression using up to 2 threads.\\
Compressing objects: 100% (2/2), done.\\
Writing objects: 100% (3/3), 316 bytes, done.\\
Total 3 (delta 1), reused 0 (delta 0)\\
remote: bb/acl: cydward is allowed. accepted payload.\\
To git@bitbucket.org:cydward/bb101repo.git\\
90cdbac..17040c4  master -> master

Cyd@CYDWEBTOP ~/repos/bb101repo-practice (master)\\
$\\
}}}

fields.description:
This issue came from a user comment on this page:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Using+your+Bitbucket+Issue+Tracker

Mark Mikofski wrote:\\
I'm talking about is something similar to google-code. If you want to create an issue, there is already text in the issue providing a standard that all issues then conform too.

Cyanogemod for example: http://code.google.com/p/cyanogenmod/issues/entry
fields.summary: Allow Users to Specify Template Text for the Content section of Issue Tracker (BB-3578)

fields.description:

Please allow to set Project Logo as Favicon  for published site or allow to keep the favicon.ico(16x16 or 32x32) file at root for the same.
fields.summary: Favicon for published website on bitbucket (BB-3455)

fields.description:
Clicking the root breadcrump while browsing a tree at the time of a specific cs will loose that context and default to the tip of master again.

E.g. https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/aui-archive/src/77557c1443ba/auiplugin/src, clicking the aui-archive breadcrump (root) in the path will loose the cs hash 77557c1443ba, it just points to https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/aui-archive/src but the aui-plugin breadcrump before is linked correctly to https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/aui-archive/src/77557c1443ba/auiplugin/. So aui-archive should link to https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/aui-archive/src/77557c1443ba instead of https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/aui-archive/src
fields.summary: Root breadcrump is losing context (BB-3579)

fields.description: It is possible to preview new issues and comments made to issues but not for pull requests. Seems like a natural extension.
fields.summary: Add preview option for pull requests and comments in pull requests (BB-3905)

fields.description:
Can we add "XPages" as a list of languages for a Repository please.

XPages is not an individaul language itself, but is a web app environment from IBM that sits on top of Java Server Faces.  It uses Java, Html, Client JavaScript, and Server JavaScript as it's typical languages.

Thank you so much for you time and consideration.
fields.summary: Please add new Language

fields.description:
If you have an account, registered with email X for example.\\
And in a second account, the you add that email as an additional email, and confirm it, your old account goes to limbo.

If you login with email X you will login at the second account (assuming they have the same password).\\
If you remove the email from second account, you will no be able to login back with email X again.

I don't know if the first account gets deleted or just inaccessible. But I believe it's not an intended behavior. Probably you want the warn the user before confirmation, or even don't allow it at all.
fields.summary: User gets deleted if his email is added to another account (BB-3573)

fields.description:
Hi guys!\\
Can you plz show the date and the author of last comment on issue page?\\
I think it would be a very nice feature.\\
Thanx! Have a nice day.
fields.summary: Issues list should include “last activity” rather than “date created” (BB-3575)
